page.title: 04 MARTLESHAM CHURCH
page.content: Martlesham Church is a typical example of a well-cared-for Suffolk Church.It stands on the site of a church mentioned in the first Doomsday Survey. The church was built on top of a hill over-looking the River Deben.There must have been a good view of invaders sailing up the river. Now the church is surrounded by trees. Inside the church is an ancient mural of St.Christopher carrying the Christ Child.It was painted in the year 1400. There is an old chest which used to hold the communion silver.It has a hollowed out poplar tree trunk as a lid. The chest was rescued from the Rectory stables in 1859 where it had been used as a corn bin! In the grave yard we found some tomb stones dating back to 1771.
